intro: Manihot neoglaziovii, commonly known as the Neoglaziovii arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
